# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    lines = IOBuffer()
    for word in split(text, ' ')
        if length(word) > text_width - 1 # We subtract one for the space between words
            while true
                i = findfirst(c -> c == ' ' || c == '\n', word, text_width - 1)
                if i === nothing
                    write(lines, "\n" * word)
                else
                    # Write up to the space or newline found
                    write(lines, substring(word, 1:i-1))
                    if i > text_width - 1 # If the space is at the end of the line, we need a new line
                        write(lines, "\n" * substr(word, i+1:length(word)))
                    end
                    break
                end
            end
        else
            write(lines, word)
            write(lines, ' ') # Append a space if it's not the last word
        end
    end
    return lines
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there! How are you today? This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line."
wrapped_text = String(wrap_string(text, text_width=10))
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function will output the following:

```
Hello there!
How are you today?
This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line.
```
